posts.content:
I am playing on a custom HGLL server, so some mobs have unnaturally high AC/AB and saves. I am only planning up to level 40 though. I was wanting a decent monk that can take a bit of a beating, and has stealth like qualities. Does anyone have any recommendations for what I have come up with?

Server specific notes:
The server states that if you take a class, you must have 5 levels in the class minimum.
The server also uses a custom orc subrace that adds +4str +3con -1int -1wis on top of the normal orc stats.
Items go up to +12 for every slot.
Getting the server cap of +20 dex from items is rather easy.
Things like knockdown immunity, status immunity are built into a lot of the higher end items. (Improved invisibility scrolls are easily attainable from vendors in mid level areas)
I only need to be able to pick 45 DC locks with the take 20 rule, lock picks, and +7 worth of open lock via items that can be switched out of if needed. The DC 90 locks are out of the question.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Rather then list the many changes I suggest, I just made an altered version of the build. This version has -44 health, +1 AB, +1 Fort saves, and -1 Will saves. Pre-epic, you get some important feats earlier, like Uncanny Dodge, Weapon Spec, and Blind Fight.

Circle Kick has a problem: it changes your target. The better strategy is to stay with one target until it is dead, thus reducing the number of enemies sooner.

If you are fighting unarmed, you need 16 levels of Monk to get that d20 damage die. Taking this further, you could optionally trade 3 more levels of Fighter for Monk, which would cost you 46 health (2 lost Epic Fortitude and 3 levels of d8 instead of d10 health), but gain you +1 AC and immunity to mind effects, as well as Empty Body (50% concealment) and more monk speed, and a few more skill points.

posts.author: Dante2377
posts.content:
I'd generally have Empty Body than rely on lvl 7 (or maybe its 9) scrolls of Imp Invis because most of the worlds I play on, the enemy casters actually dispel things, which will take your concealment from 50 to 0 like that.

Also not sure if by "status immunity" you mean things like mind effects, etc. Also, will you be playing in a party or solo? Hard to say with so many environment details left out, but I'd generally go something like monk20/sd5/ftr14 and 1 level of whatever left over.

Not sure why you guys are pumping str and con and leaving wisdom and INT low - on a dex monk with epic dodge and empty body (or II scroll), the higher the AC is, the more cumulative the defensive benefit is (unless you're already at an AC that means enemies will only hit on 19-20 but that doesn't seem to be the case given the OP). Don't have time to throw in CBC sheet, but I'd leave the str as default 8 +4 subrace = 12 and move the points into wis and int for skills and AC.

Also, Empyre, Great Cleave by itself (ie. not a prereq for dev crit) has always been pretty meh for me (i.e. not worth it), I'd rather have something like Expertise or take an extra save on a general and slide a fighter bonus feat down.

Also as a general comment, from what I've seen from high magic environments, many of them have a ton of damage bonuses on weapons/gloves (i.e. over 100 pts or more collectively); in those environments, weapon spec/EWS tend not to be worth 2 feats, 1 of them epic, for 6 damage. I don't know if HGLL is like that, but if it is, I'd recommend almost anything else.

posts.author: a11jks2001
posts.content:
Sorry for leaving a little bit of information out. When I mentioned status immunity, I meant things like mind-affecting, poison, ability drain, level drain, knockdown. Another note is that the subrace adds its stats on top of what half-orcs already have, thus adding +6STR +3CON-1WIS -3INT -2CHA overall. I should note that many mobs have rogue levels and HiPS, so you will be caught flat-footed and flanked a lot. Unfortunately, I do not know the exact stats of the high level mobs, but I do know that the server's strongest character, completely party and self buffed, has about 98AC (guesstimating he only gets hit on 15-20s) and 95AB (guesstimating he only misses on very low rolls.) He is a level 5 rogue 42 barbarian 7 weapon master wearing all +12 items, so while raging he has very high HP 1350 without temporary hp buffs.

As for the items, all weapons have some amazing attributes. For example, 2h weapons have shield modifiers and massive critical built in. Based off of this, I know that monk gloves will also have some great stats; the only magical property that I know of on the quest rewarded monk gloves is high elemental damage bonus(es).

I agree, expertise and even improved expertise instead of extra saves. This would come in handy since the build will only be hitting legendary level things on 19-20 attack rolls. In order to get those feats, I need to put a total of 10 into INT on char creation; I will have to remove some points from DEX in order to increase INT anymore.

EDIT:
I will touch on skill points a little. Hide, move silently, tumble, discipline, listen, spot, and open lock are the only useful skills on the server for melee. The rest are really only good for RP reasons. You have to be careful with skill points, because DEX based characters, for example, can easily hit 127 hide/move silently rather easily. True sight was changed to give you +25 spot and listen bonus, making stealth characters capable of actually being unseen. My point is, you won't be able to spot other players unless your build is capable of getting very high spot bonuses.

posts.author: Dante2377
posts.content:
well unless you really jack INT, you won't be able to get 13 INT for Imp Expertise (you would need 16 before the -3), but based on AC calc below, I wouldn't worry about it.

In terms of AC, you should hit 100 easy in a +12 environment as a dex character. Lets assume end dex of 32 and you said it would be easy to hit +20 DEX cap, so DEX=52 with a modifier of +21.

Base +10
Tumble +8
Armor Skin +2
Robes (+12) +12
Boots +12 dodge +12
Haste +4 dodge
Amulet +12 natural
Deflection +12
Dex +21
Wisdom +12 (assume starting wisdom 14 and you said easy to reach +20 cap, so WIS34 = +12 modifier)
Monk +3 (could be +4 with monk 20)

that's AC=108 right there and you can still get +4 additional from capping your +20 dodge. If you have insane items that give shield bonuses even when not wearing a shield, then you have all your additional +20 shield AC bonus as well to find from items. So seems like lots of leeway on the AC side.

Since it seems like a power-gaming environment, I guess the question is why are you going with a half-orc that gets str and con bonuses, rather than dex, especially since you'll have an XP penalty at various points and after 40 with your build (Empy's doesn't have that but I'd get monk 18 to get empty body and switch FTR around). It would seem a race with dex/wis bonuses might be more beneficial from a power perspective, but to each their own. I say that because if flanking/sneaks are a big issue, you could work a dwarf race in and sub out the fighter levels for DD to be protected from flanking, but based on your AC, that might not be an issue, and the feats lost might be a big issue.

Either way, if there's dispelling your poor Imp Invis scrolls won't last long, so I'd get Empty Body.

If you're looking for a dex-based stealthy guy WITH a big punch, Max posted one awhile back that I'll PM you as to not derail this build that I recommend highly in either low or high magic.
